availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Edwards (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Newman Edwards in Warren County, Kentucky, on February 27, 1836. Father of Thomas Edwards, Richard E. Edwards, James W. Edwards, George E. Edwards, Frances E. Edwards, J. A. Edwards, John N. Edwards, Mary E. Edwards, Sally V. Edwards, and Bettie M. Edwards. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Warren County Marriages, Film 000339890.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 000164009.
